ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
TMB Vocabulary - Type of Assessment
TMB Vocabulary - Type of trial
TMB Vocabulary - Probe Word
TMB Vocabulary - Target Word
TMB Vocabulary - Word chosen by the user
TMB Vocabulary - Response correctness, Boolean
TMB Vocabulary - Trial reaction time (ms)
TMB Vocabulary - Event triggered by the response
Notes: 1= Timeout, no response until timeout; 2= Keyup, keyboard keypress; 3= Pointerup-mouse, mouse click; 4= Touchend/pointerup-touch, touchscreen touch

ElementDescription: TMB Vocabulary - Number of correct ''test'' trials
TMB Vocabulary - Proportion of correct responses for ''test'' trials
TMB Vocabulary - Average reaction time of correct responses to ''test'' trials (ms)
TMB Vocabulary - Median reaction time of correct responses to ''test'' trials (ms)
TMB Vocabulary - Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to ''test'' trials (ms)
TMB Vocabulary - User response device
TMB Vocabulary - Test script version
